Posts.Content: Let-HT wrote: Hi all, A new Canadian clinical study has just started to reduce breast cancer risk in high risk women who have been using hormone therapy for treating menopausal symptoms (this adds to their risk), the study depends on an interesting idea of using aromatase inhibitors to minimize breast estrogen while keeping some baseline estrogen in your blood using low dose estrogen. They measure your breast estrogen in this study as well by a fine needle biopsy to see if your breast is responding well to the treatment. You can read more in www.togetherwepreventbreastcancer.com Cheers Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Reducing breast cancer risk in HRT users Let-HT Let-HT
